The symptoms and laboratory results suggest that the patient is suffering from paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria (PNH), a rare disorder of the blood characterized by the destruction of red blood cells by the complement system, leading to hemoglobinuria. Eculizumab is a monoclonal antibody used to treat PNH. The low platelet count puts the patient at risk for bleeding, and rituximab has not been shown to be effective in treating PNH. Urinary hemosiderin testing would be positive, not negative, in this condition.
